data.title: DirectX error when starting any game or SDK version 6.99.9
data.body:
When I start RenPy SDK 6.99.9 I get following traceback. I can press Ignore and continue but this error is annoying. I found this bug in my favorite game which updated today to RenPy Engine 6.99.9 and I decided to test this in SDK (maybe this is engine-specific error, not game-specific).
[traceback.txt](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/174150/traceback.txt)

I run Windows 10, build 10586. GPU - Nvidia Geforce GTX 550 Ti, driver version 353.82.
There is no problems with visual novels that run on older versions of RenPy.

ps sorry for my bad english,

data.title: undefined symbol: PySurface_New
data.body:
After c3e464311e244da1980d6f9cc365cf3df25b949f, launching manually built renpy fails with the following message:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "renpy.py", line 195, in <module>
    main()
  File "renpy.py", line 192, in main
    renpy.bootstrap.bootstrap(renpy_base)
  File "renpy/bootstrap.py", line 252, in bootstrap
    renpy.import_all()
  File "renpy/__init__.py", line 427, in import_all
    import renpy.audio.audio
  File "renpy/audio/audio.py", line 40, in <module>
    import renpy.audio.renpysound as renpysound
ImportError: env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/renpy/audio/renpysound.so: undefined symbol: PySurface_New
```

Looks like there's missing dependency on pgext (or alternative implementation).

data.title: Japanese font issues.
Disable audio channel during fast skip.
Screenshots delay until the mouse moves.
data.body: Or some other interface event happens.

data.title: Document the change to the default image init priority
data.body:
When init offset support was added in commit 679f9e31, the default image init
priority was changed from 500 to 990. This changes it back.

data.title: Interface 7 TODO
data.body:
- [x] Help screen.
- [x] Indicate newest save slot.
- [x] Rewrite gui.rpy to take advantage of the fixed in the game_menu screen.
- [x] Ensure buttons and bars have an insensitive state.
- [x] Viewport Grid (partially-rendering viewport).
- [x] Improved RevertableList rollback.
- [x] NVL-mode screens.
- [x] Vbar images.
- [x] Button images.
- [x] New preferences design.
- [x] Fix yesno, about, and help style names.
- [x] Rename "screen yesno_prompt" to "screen confirm"
- [x] Rename "file_picker" to "file_slots".
- [x] Skip mode indicator.
- [x] Notification screen.
- [x] History screen.
- [x] Document HistoryEntry, _history, and _history_list.
- [x] Main Menu / Game Menu images.
- [x] NVLEntry.
- [x] ChoiceEntry Objects
- [x] Increase button padding.
- [x] Tablet gui - preferences.
- [x] 1-base save slots. (Start with 1, rather than 0.)
- [x] Expose quick/auto saves on slots.
- [x] Audit all style names.
- [x] Phone gui - not sure.
- [x] CTC indicator? At least better support for one. CTC screen?

data.title: Ensure that translations can deal with triple_quoted strings.
renpy.py uses not widely supported shebang
data.body:
Regressed by ecd36ec.

```
$ uname -sr
FreeBSD 11.0-CURRENT
$ ./renpy.py
env: python #@PydevCodeAnalysisIgnore: No such file or directory
```

http://www.in-ulm.de/~mascheck/various/shebang/#comments

data.title: style_prefix and style_suffix
data.body:
These should be two new properties on displayables. Style_prefix should also be available on screens.

Style_prefix would be like style_group, except without the implied _ at the end of it. Style_suffix is the flip side of it - it's combined with style_prefix to make a full style name, if style is not defined.

Style_prefix should be inheritable, while style_suffix should not be.

data.title: Use Markdown to improve the GitHub issues
data.body:
I'm suggesting the use of _templates_ to improve the creation of issues.

`ISSUE_TEMPLATE.MD` redirects to `CONTRIBUTING.MD` that contains a basic guide about syntax highlighting with Markdown.

I don't revised English yet. First I would like to know what you think about this suggestion.

You can see how this works by my fork issue tracker.
https://github.com/williamd1k0/renpy/issues/new

data.title: feature suggestion: associate key to button
data.body:
With the advent of Steam controllers and many people who like gamepad to play games, I think this new function would be a good addition. In practice the possibility to associate a key to a button. Like if you press "i" key, or the gamepad "Y" button, you open inventory. Right now we have to do:
screen blabla:
    key "i" action Inventory()
    textbutton "Open Inventory" action Inventory()

my idea would be simply to add a parameter to text/image/button widget like:
key "XYZ"
or if key is not possible any other keyword like alt_key etc.

This would be useful in games since you could code them for example like the Telltale series, in which there are 4 choices and each one it's associated to a gamepad button (X,Y,A,B).

"afm" toggle crash
data.body:
With the (almost) latest nightly the afm toggle craches if I hit my imagebutton frequntly, or my bounded "A" key toggle function. Short version/example:

```
    imagebutton idle "x" hover "x" selected_idle "x" focus_mask None action Preference("auto-forward", "toggle")

    def _toggle_afm():
        _preferences.afm_enable = not _preferences.afm_enable
        renpy.restart_interaction()

```

Error:

> While running game code:
> TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +=: 'float' and 'NoneType'
> 
> -- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------
> 
> Full traceback:
>   File "/home/xxx/xxx/xxx.rpyc", line xx, in script
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/ast.py", line 604, in execute
>     renpy.exports.say(who, what, interact=self.interact)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/exports.py", line 1122, in say
>     who(what, interact=interact)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/character.py", line 828, in **call**
>     self.do_display(who, what, cb_args=self.cb_args, *_display_args)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/character.py", line 690, in do_display
>     *_display_args)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/character.py", line 493, in display_say
>     rv = renpy.ui.interact(mouse='say', type=type, roll_forward=roll_forward)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/ui.py", line 277, in interact
>     rv = renpy.game.interface.interact(roll_forward=roll_forward, *_kwargs)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/display/core.py", line 2425, in interact
>     repeat, rv = self.interact_core(preloads=preloads, *_kwargs)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/display/core.py", line 3096, in interact_core
>     rv = root_widget.event(ev, x, y, 0)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/display/layout.py", line 906, in event
>     rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/display/layout.py", line 906, in event
>     rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/display/layout.py", line 906, in event
>     rv = i.event(ev, x - xo, y - yo, cst)
>   File "/home/xxx/RenPy/renpy-nightly/renpy/display/behavior.py", line 526, in event
>     afm_delay += self.text.get_time()
> TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +=: 'float' and 'NoneType'
> 
> Linux-4.1.15-gentoo-r1-x86_64-Intel-R-_Core-TM-_i7-3770K_CPU_@_3.50GHz-with-gentoo-2.2
> Ren'Py 6.99.9.1138

Just me?

renpy.play to use audio channel by default.
allow <silence 3> rather than <silence to 3>

Partial playback isn't showing the first few frames of video.
block_rollback is being called on reload
Ignore partial playback when determining if a sound has been seen.
Dequeue frames from a movie that's playing but isn't shown.
Pausing audio.
Only read video frames if all video channels have frames available.
Build Ren'Py with SDL2-2.0.4 (on Desktop)
data.body:
This is necessary to properly set the system timer rate to 1ms, which is required for smooth movie playback.

While doing this, check that we still have windows HIGHDPI support, and that everything works on all platforms.
